lessons.title: TodoList Component
lessons.explanation: We will create a new todo list component in a separate file.
lessons.task: Type the code for a component called TodoList that contains a span which displays "Todo List!"
descriptions: The TodoList component will display the entire task list.
The export keyword allows other files or modules to use the component.

replacements.content: // Change to app.tsx to see the code

experiments.comment: It's possible to put this in the main app file.
However, it's better to keep related components in their own file.

lessons.title: Use the TodoList Component
lessons.objective: Use the TodoList component as the main component of the app.
lessons.explanation: We will use the TodoList component in the App component.
lessons.task: Type the tag for the TodoList component.
descriptions: The App contains only the TodoList component.
It's good to keep the main App component simple.

lessons.title: Import the TodoList Component
lessons.objective: Import the TodoList component to use it in this file.
lessons.explanation: We need to import the TodoList component in order to use it. (This was already done for you in the last step.)
descriptions: The Todo List is imported from the ./todo path.
A path that starts with a single period like './todo' means that the file is in the same directory.
If the import path starts with two periods, it means the file is in a parent directory ../parent-folder.
The imported TodoList component is wrapped in { } because it is a single item that is exported from the target file.
The import React statement does not use { } because it is using a default export.

lessons.title: TodoItem Component
lessons.explanation: We need to create another TodoItem component.
lessons.task: Type the declaration for the TodoItem
descriptions: The TodoItem component is declared as a const variable.

experiments.comment: The TodoItem could be exported also, but it shouldn't be since it is only a part of the TodoList.

lessons.title: TodoItem props
lessons.objective: Declare the props and it's type.
lessons.explanation: We need to define the props type.
lessons.task: Type the props parameter that is an object type with a string text field.
descriptions: The text field is a string type.
The props component parameter is an object that has a text field.

experiments.comment: It's possible to use an optional component parameter which would use a default value when missing.

lessons.title: TodoItem Body
lessons.objective: Define the body of the TodoItem component.
lessons.explanation: We need display the text value from the props.
lessons.task: Type the component body that returns a div tag which contains the text of the props.
descriptions: In jsx, the { } symbols are used to switch back to the javascript code context where the props variable exists.
The props object has a text field that is a string.
This component will render the text inside a div element.

experiments.comment: It's possible to modify the string as needed.

lessons.title: TodoItem Usage
lessons.explanation: Now we need to use the TodoItem component.
lessons.task: Type a div element that has 3 TodoItems that say A, B, and C.
descriptions: The div element will group the list of TodoItem components.
The TodoItem needs a text attribute with a string value.

experiments.comment: We can manually hard code some tasks, but that's not quite useful yet.
